description: Buy the Camp Chef Pro 90X Three-Burner Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pro 90X Three-Burner Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Pro 90X Three-Burner Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great Stove.  I own three total, but this one is our elk camp stove.  We use it 3 weeks per year and it's buried in a stash on our property the rest of the year.  It's been up there for 18 years and fires up every time we pull it out.  We also have the two burner and three burner griddle that have lasted since our very first three burner stove over 20 years ago.
review.name: Great Heavy Duty Stove

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a gift for my daughter and son in law. They love it.
review.name: Camp chef pro 90x

review.reviewBody: So far set up is easy , love the adjustable legs easy to level, a lot of of space for cooking, fits nicely in the storage unit of my 5th wheel
review.name: Glamping stove

review.reviewBody: We use this all the time, but especially in the summer so that our kitchen doesn't get any more heat, thus saving money by lightening our a/c burden. Natural gas conversion made this convenient for our patio. In our second summer and we are using this with gratitude that it is such a great item that puts out BTUs adequate for pizza and wok cooking.
review.name: Summer cooking - soup, pizza, BBQ, grilling

review.reviewBody: Awesome product grill covers that can be used for tables  are not to sturdy burns extremely hot will burn food fast if not monitored and burner not ajusted
review.name: Pro 16

review.reviewBody:
Love this stove. Lots of BTUs and space for multiple big pots and pans. 

Small problem though. Chrome plating is coming off the grill after a single use. Is there a fox for this!
review.name: Great stove in every way

review.reviewBody: Great grill overall  but the side shelfs do not lay flat more like on an angle not a big fan of that layout and there  are no adjustments for them so not Happy with that
review.name: Side shelfs

review.reviewBody: Great, really enjoy using it. better than expected
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: Purchased Denali Pro 16 one month ago, used once and found the grate tarnished and silver coating peeling off, is this normal or a fault? 2 pics included, please advise
review.name: Grill problem (1095) tarnished & peeling off coat

review.reviewBody:
I bought this camp stove last year.  With three burners I am able to BBQ and have two additional burners. I love the fact that it can be folded down and moved for storing. While it is heavy, the wheels help to move it. 
This year I’ll be canning outside using all three burners.
review.name: Amazing!

name: Pro 90X Three-Burner Stove

hasVariant.name: Kid Comfort Active Carrier

review.reviewBody: I bought this especially for my son to give to him at his wife’s baby shower. It wasn’t on their list but I remembered how much my husband and I used one 34 years ago. WOW do I wish I had this. All the bells and whistles are on this.   Any active outdoor parent or grandparent needs this. Even to walk the dog! I’m 64 and I can’t wait to try it. It’s lightweight and so easy to put on.
review.name: A great shower gift for the Dads!

name: Kid Comfort Active Carrier

review.reviewBody:
A little long in the sleeves, otherwise excellent fit.
A small zippered pocket is a must, and this has one.
review.name: Nice jersey

review.reviewBody: As a woman, I often buy men’s xs jerseys. Fits great thru the shoulders and length but as others have said - the bottom is made for someone with a belly. Still works well. Love the design!
review.name: Great design, good fit

review.reviewBody: Great fit - looks good Buttrying to match the color of my new Trek Domane+ - juniper green. This one looks great but didn’t match color so reluctantly had to return.
review.name: New kit to match new bike

review.reviewBody: Bro this shirt is so nice and it made me so fast! I mean I cut through the wind like a greased hog!! Big boy pushin that 54/11 gear like it ain’t Nuttin’!! Lady’s in the park be like is that Pre PED Lance!?? Nah, it’s big boy dicin the wind like a Ninja in his Gorewear shirt!!!!
review.name: Pre PED Lance

review.reviewBody:
Similar to another reviewer's experience, this was an ill-fitting jersey: too snug around the shoulders and very baggy around the midriff.  Definitely not for those with an "inverted pyramid" type upper body.  My cheap Chinese jersey fit much better than this one.  The material was also fairly beefy, not something I'd appreciate on hot days.  The only appeal is the style and color.

I purchased the Orbit Blue jersey.  The website shows a white zipper, but the zipper of the actual product was black.
review.name: Bad fit

review.reviewBody:
Love the look and quality of the jersey but the fit is really weird (Lg). It fits great on my shoulders, neck, and arms but it's kind of baggy around the waste\stomach area.  It feels like I could size down (Md) but having done so, the neck was so tight and constricting that I went back to a large.  The back of the jersey sags as well because of this design.  When you carry a few items in the pockets it hangs pretty low. 

I also found the fit to vary between the jerseys.  I bought 3 of these in different colors at different times.  The first 2 fit fairly well (considering) and the 3rd was a bit more loose than the others around the stomach.  

I would definitely follow the size chart and take your measurements to ensure you get the right size or as close to it as possible.  I fit closer to the medium side but found the top of the jersey to be too constricting in that size where as the large fit right at the top but weird at the bottom.
review.name: Stylish but really weird fit

name: C5 Optiline Jersey - Men's

hasVariant.name: Core 3 Floor Pump
hasVariant.description: Buy the Blackburn Core 3 Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Gauge is easy to read, but I've had this less than a year, and it seems like only about one in ten of my strokes actually puts any air into the tire. The rest of the effort is lost as it sounds like the air bleeds out somewhere before getting into the tire. Was a waste of money, i already have to buy a new floor pump.
review.name: Doesn't work

review.reviewBody: Tall pump. Worked great for a few months, but then had to pump really fast to get the pump to fill our tires. Seems like a faulty seal in the pump stand. Easily exchangeable head. Difficult to get to engage the threads on the stem. You have to keep pressure the filler valve on the tire stem and pushing down on the engagement lever. This is harder to do when the valve is at the top of the tire rotation.
review.name: Crapped out after 4 months of use

name: Core 3 Floor Pump

description: Buy the Injinji Trail Midweight Mini-Crew Xtralife online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Trail Midweight Mini-Crew Xtralife
hasVariant.description: Buy the Injinji Trail Midweight Mini-Crew Xtralife online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these foot gloves to try beings I’ve never worn anything like it before. They are the most comfortable socks ever. Everyone should try them out at least once. Injinji is the brand with the best quality. I recently bought some other cheaper brand. They don’t compete.
review.name: Absolute comfort

review.reviewBody: I hiked the AT in Darn Toughs. Started the PCT in them and due to shoe change was murder. Lost 2 toenails and was the worst my feet have ever been. Switched to Injinji midweight, haven't had a blister since. Over 10K trail thru hike  miles. PCT,CDT, AZT and 11 other long distance trails. I think the key is they have a low friction give in the fabric and solve any between toe issues. They last forever. Way longer than DT.  I now only wear Injinji  even at work.  They are perfect and one of the pieces of gear I use that I wont ever have to change unless they change. Zero complaints. 2 pair lasted me the entire CDT if that says anything and I probably still have those pair in my sock drawer.  I tried the merino wool ones and they didn't last on a thru hike. I cant recommend that version. I wear a size 10 Lone peak with toes about 1 inch shy of toe box end  and wear size large Injinji's. The only Con is they can be a chore to put on when wet but nothing major.
review.name: Worn these for 10K miles

review.reviewBody: The past few years when I have gone on some long hikes in the Grand Canyon and  I have been getting blisters between my big toe and my second due to the rubbing. I just did R2R in the Grand Canyon and not a single blister or hot spot. My feet felt great and I?m ready for more hikes.
review.name: Blister reducer

name: Trail Midweight Mini-Crew Xtralife

review.reviewBody: Great shoes, 11 out of 10 for comfort and design. However, they're not as durable as I would have hoped. One third of the way into the 175mi Tahoe Rim Trail left the tread in ribbons. Replaced them on the next resupply with same shoe given comfort level. Just recommend Hoka improves the tread durability in the future.
review.name: Great design and excellent comfort, but....

review.reviewBody: It's light it's good looking from first shoes made by Hoka. It's extremely comfortable
review.name: This I will buy again

review.reviewBody: I am an overweight runner with a hitch in my get-along so I need a tough shoe. These are working out pretty good, the outer sole is almost worn out at 250 miles, but they are still comfortable to run 4-5 miles a day in. Most shoes I wear 11.5 but I wear 12 in Hokas, the fit is good.
review.name: Good shoe for me.

review.reviewBody: I originally bought these shoes locally at a different store. Unfortunately, they don't have anymore of this shoe in my size. So I came here and picked up two more pairs as I use them daily. The Good: The Foam is great for about 3 months. The heel support is much better than other varieties of Hoka's I own. The Mid: Width Sizing is a little tight on me. Length sizing is fine. The Bad: The shoe is disposable and expensive. I'm under 170 lbs and the foam blows out in under 500 miles (walking). It's a night and day difference once the foam goes.
review.name: I ordered 2 extra pairs - Daily Driver

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable shoes I've ever owned
review.name: Best shoes ever

review.reviewBody: Comfortable as always, but now I know why these were on closeout. They are very vibrant!!
review.name: Really bright!!

review.reviewBody: This was my second pair purchased in a few weeks . My first pair was also the Challenger 7 . They are light , supportive and comfortable . Wearing them all day without any discomfort to my feet.
review.name: Extremely comfortable

review.reviewBody: I buy 9 2ee because 9 is pretty narrow for my foot.At first very comfortable.Take couple days for foot to settle in. But two months wearing them for work insert wrinkles under ball of foot very uncomfortable. Replace insert with new one from Birkenstock Air cushion and work weary well. And about 3 months wear heal lining inside start falling a part.
review.name: I don't know if I buy it again

review.reviewBody: For me they are the ideal shoe. They provide wonderful arch support and are light weight. Very durable and nice looking. I'd buy them again.
review.name: I would buy these shoes again.

review.reviewBody: I recently bought Hoka. For the first time. The shoe size I ordered was a bit too small and Hoka exchanged them without any problems. Just text he new shoe and proper size and they feel absolutely amazing
review.name: I would buy this product again and again

name: Challenger ATR 7 Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Aequilibrium Top GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super comfy mountaineering boot. I bought this boot to climb the Ortler in 2025. I have used it in the Whites (NH) twice and to get used to it in Bear Mountain, NY. The BOA system makes all the difference to make the shoe feel like a glove. I got Petzl Crampons for them but haven’t tried in snow (yet). According to reviews the heel can be complicated in crampons but I think you just need a proper fitting. Speaking of size, I used the Mondo system (cm) to find my size which resulted in sizing up by half a size in US size. Overall, best mountaineering boot I ever had and I had the Mammut Taiss and Scarpa Ribelle before.
review.name: Walking on clouds in the clouds

review.itemreviewed: Aequilibrium Top GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: They feel light, you can still kick in to medium to soft stuff and put your weight into them, and they protect your feet enough for fast shale descents and a little rocky mayhem… Even if barely.  Zippers are a pain but I got used to them. Just spent seven days in them in Alaska, still holding up good. I used them for a quick trip in early may and my feet got cold but that could have been partially the fit/sock problem. Feet staid warm on this most recent august trip though.
review.name: Light and Capable

review.itemreviewed: Aequilibrium Top GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Poor quality on the zipper, it got stuck from the first use. It took me almost 10 minutes to unblock the zipper in freezing weather and it no longer works. I had better expectations of a brand like La Sportiva.
review.name: Poor Zipper Quality

name: Aequilibrium Top GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Peak Design Motorcycle Stem Mount online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Motorcycle Stem Mount
hasVariant.description: Buy the Peak Design Motorcycle Stem Mount online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Sturdy and easy to install couldn’t ask for anything more
review.name: Better than QuadLock

review.reviewBody: The mount and the case are both super high quality and the magnet connection feels very strong and durable. Was easy enough to install and I’ll probably buy more products. It is expensive, but I think it’s worth it compared to other similar products out there.
review.name: Awesome mount!

review.reviewBody:
Just got it a week ago, really nice product.
Feels like a product that’s last a long time.
review.name: Nice product!!

review.reviewBody: I bought the motorcycle stem mount to use on my bicycle.  I have an Ortlieb front handlebar bag and needed a phone mount that would attach to the stem.  I like the Peak Design phone mount system and thought this would work.  This motorcycle stem mount works perfectly.  The hollow steering stem nut is easily removed by sliding it out of the slot in the cap.  I then slightly expanded the hole in the cap by drilling it out to fit a 6 mm stem cap screw.  This provides a rock solid attachment to the bike, plus I can easily adjust the viewing angle of the phone.  And I can still lift the lid of my handlebar bag and access the contents with the phone attached to the mount.
review.name: Works for Bicycles Too!

review.reviewBody: This is a slick mount. I've seen videos comparing this to other popular mounts where they try and pry the phone off. All of the mounts performed, which is to say that Peak also held the phone, despite the low profile attachment connector thingy. I think Peak is also the cheapest of the other three options.
review.name: Slick Mount

review.reviewBody: I bought this along with a bar mount for the Multistrada and an Everyday Case for my iPhone 14 Pro Max. The stem mount attached easily and securely to the Ducati stem and the adjustable arm allowed me to place the large phone in an easily viewable position that does not interfere with the tank or other parts of the motorcycle. Great product.
review.name: Great for Ducati Panigale Variants

review.reviewBody: When I saw this compared to the Quad Lock, I was so much more impressed with PD’s version. And it really was better. Definitely recommend this to anyone who’s shopping for something like it. The entire ecosystem is great.
review.name: As usual, Peak Design Perfection

review.reviewBody:
My adventure motorcycle riding is quite bumpy at times. Bike takes dirt naps. This mount has never let me down. The dampening is fantastic. I have 5 of them now.. easy attach, easy detach. I have the car mount too! Next is my mountain bike.. I love this company!! Simple yet amazingly strong. 
Yes, I’m a raving fan. I’ve had others that were more complex but not as strong.. if this company goes public, I’m in!! Innovative and excellent customer support..
review.name: BULLETPROOF!!

review.reviewBody: After using the Ram phone mount for several years, I decided I wanted a better way to secure my phone. I researched various mounts and their respective product reviews and designed to purchase Peak Design. I am NOT disappointed. The magnetic locking mechanism is unbelievably strong, and my phone doesn’t move (I also purchased the Peak Design phone case as well). There are versatile mounting options and as you can see, I didn’t have a lot of space on my handle bars but it worked out perfectly and the height is even better for my vision. The phone is easily detached by pressing 2 side buttons. I also like that the product is guaranteed for life.
review.name: Outstanding Phone Mount

review.reviewBody: I have a variation of this on every bike that I own and can tell you that this is the best phone holder for motorcycles! I have tried all of the major brands. This system allows you to continue to charge through qi chargers or mag safe chargers. The clips hold your phone very well, has vibration dampening, and the magnets pull your phone onto the clips for proper alignment. There is no phone mount better! I am hoping that they come out with a charging mount for motorcycles soon. That is all that is left to be desired.
review.name: Motorcycle Stem Mount Phone Holder

name: Motorcycle Stem Mount

review.reviewBody: I just finished my first hike in these shoes. Did 8 miles in the white mountains. The boots are practically destroyed. The toe tip is peeling off. A big chunk is missing from the sole. Junk.
review.name: I want my money back.

review.reviewBody: Bought these as soon as they came out for a busy summer. My first adventure was a Grand Canyon Rim-2-Rim hike in July. 24+ miles in one day. These were fantastic. Perfect in the extreme heat and dried relatively quickly after a few stream crossings. I then wore these on a 24 hour (42 mile) hike through the mountains of north Georgia. Very hot and humid, and again no issues with discomfort or blisters. Even after wading through several streams. I have over 100 miles in these and my feet were not a factor and I never thought about my shoes.
review.name: Grand Canyon and Northern Georgia Tested

review.reviewBody: Not sure what footstape these are supposed to be but they are nothing like the way my past Altra shoes have fit. Latest set I have is the lone peak and these are way too narrow and long. Sending back.
review.name: Odd Shape

review.reviewBody:
Was a Solomon 4d user, too heavy and needed bandaids often. Switched to Altria 7, but not enough support and too soft at front of shoe. These Timps are awesome. Not too heavy and relatively good overall fit.  I love the wide toe box and overall feel.  I bought 2 pairs of these and one using Gore for wet conditions. 

The shoelaces on my size 14 were too short, but I switched out to longer. 

Love these boots.
review.name: Love Timp Hiker boots

review.reviewBody: They are light with great ankle support, perfectly cushioned, you can feel it at every step. I have put around 30 mile on them an going to Colorado for some real trail with high altitude
review.name: I would not only buy again but also buy a different model!!

review.reviewBody: Spent the week in Zion. Timp hikers were very good. We put on over 50 miles of hiking and I have no complaints. I could use a bit more cushion for my feet, but happy with the purchase.
review.name: Pleasantly Surprised

review.reviewBody: I've been wearing Lone Peaks for a long time, and the Timp is even a step up from those other early models. Though I've had surgery on both feet and can't wear a lot of other hikers, these are comfortable in all aspects. Lightweight, not too hot, good toe room, great look, quick to dry. They seem sturdy so far. Two small complaints - wish the tongue was gusseted to keep debris out, and would like a swatch of heel velcro for gaiters. But those are minor issues. I will be buying a second pair to keep on the shelf until next year or whenever these wear out. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: This hiking shoe is so smooth. The weight of the shoe is so light which is exactly what I need with ankle issues. I went half a step up because I wear ankle braces that fit comfortably inside the shoe. I usually wear an 11 in Altra but got 11.5 to accommodate the ankle supports. The high top hides most of my ankle support which is nice. I highly recommend this shoe for those that are challenged physically by their feet with some mobility issues. For me it means I can enjoy more pain-fee hikes and walks around the city/country.
review.name: YES! This is the one!

review.reviewBody: All purpose shoe for me, use for hiking along with every day use, very durable & very comfortable.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: I think Altra has finally "nailed it" with this hiker. I have been wearing various Alta lone peaks for years and most (not all) of them were pretty good. Now that I am getting older my feet need a little more cushioning when hiking .These Timp hikers are the perfect answer. I only have about 20 miles on these but I have found the toe box to be roomy, the heel secure ,extra padding welcome and the new sole quite good. Time will tell about durability. positive- The sole is noticeably grippier than the lone peaks...I think it is a good improvement overall. Fit and cushioning. Secure fit with roomy toe box. neutral- Feel is still there but slightly less than Lone Peaks. negative- No gator trap and loop. Why not put this on the hikers Altra !? ...I miss it!
review.name: This is the one for me!

name: Timp Hiker Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Post noir did not fit as noted. I at least got some bolts out of it.
review.name: Not the right part

review.reviewBody: I switched wheels out on my bike that required larger rotor adapters, and these were great because I got to use the oil slick bolts that came with them and they match the hardware on the G2 ultimate calipers.
review.name: Simple and effective

review.reviewBody: The adapters work great once you get them and the right bolts for your application.  I was going from 200 to 220 on a fox 36 so needed the 40mm adapter.  Adapter is perfect but only comes with one set of bolts - in this scenario the new setup requires 4 bolts and the 2 that came with the bike are way too long since the new adapter is offset.  I got a local bike shop to give me a couple but it would be nice to know what’s needed upfront.
review.name: can be tough to determine which one

review.reviewBody:
Not for current Sram brakes. Picture is misleading. Adapter at the bottom on the picture is not included. Just washers and spacers. 
I requested help from SRAM support. Here is an answer.
"The right adapter for your use would be 00.5318.007.004.
If you are using the current Level Ult. you won't need the washers beneath the caliper as it is a non cps caliper."
According to few people you also can use Shimano 20P adapter and it is 2x cheaper then Sram.
review.name: Outdated.

review.reviewBody: I went to a bike shop to plan ahead for when I got my 180mm rotors and new brakes to avoid delays. We couldn?t find instructions so we took apart another bike to see how they had the washers. Still didn?t get the spacers right and found helpful info posted by other reviewers. On my bike I needed the 12.5 and 7.5 mm spacers to go from 160mm to 180mm rotors. Backcountry knew about this already so I?m giving 5 stars to reviewers and 1 star the them for not providing the info (see Samual Mason?s post and link below). I spent a lot of time on this and it should have taken less than 5 minutes.
review.name: No Instructions

review.reviewBody: Worked as they should.  Easy install but did need shorter bolts to switch from current adapters to these.  Sourced stainless steel at local hardware store for a few bucks and was on my way.
review.name: 40mm post adapters

name: Post Mount Brake Adapter

hasVariant.name: Gear Wipes
hasVariant.description: Buy the Silca Gear Wipes online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Like most people, I use these when working on my bike. They are excellent for basically any cleaning purpose: they remove dirt, grease, and grime from threads, drivetrain parts, and basically any part of my bike. As a bonus, they smell great, leave no residue, and are safe to use on human skin. 
Compared to baby wipes / cheaper alternatives, these are generally very low on lint. They will sometimes get a bit cut up if using on sharp surfaces (disc brake rotors), but for a disposable cloth, it is understandable.

Like many of Silca's products, it's overpriced. I could give it a 5/5 if it cost $25 or less (this is the cycling industry, after all), but $40 is a ridiculous price when a similar (but inferior) container of presoaked cleaning cloths can be bought at the grocery store for $5-8.
review.name: Great product, but overpriced

name: Gear Wipes

review.reviewBody: I'm  5'8" 134lb,  with a with 35" chest.   I wear a 32D bra. review.itemreviewed: Dyora RS Summer Short-Sleeve Jersey - Women's

review.reviewBody: These bottom brackets are tough but they do wear out over time, fortunately they are fairly inexpensive and easy to install. I've had both the XT and the XTR on my bikes and honestly, unless you are sponsored by Shimano or saving a couple of grams will make you feel better about your bike, the XT is more than enough. XT is like the F-150 (or Tacoma) of component line ups, maybe not the fanciest in the stable, but really good at most everything and incredibly dependable.
review.name: Cheap and Easy

review.reviewBody: These boots have a lining that is super soft on your bear foot! The boot fit perfectly well! I will be getting another pair in a different color!
review.name: OMG! The most comfortable footwear I've ever worn!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, stylish, versatile and perfect for the winter. It's that simple. Just get it, you won't be disappointed, according to my son.
review.name: Winter must have

review.reviewBody: Great product fits very well and I would definitely recommend it to others
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I am happy with these boots and they have performed well. Suggestions: Lower body if it can be made out of waterproof leather. Replace the last two rows of holes for lacing with hooks for quick on and off feet.
review.name: Good quality product needing improvement

review.reviewBody: My son is the recipient of these boots! He says that they are very comfortable; with wriggle room for his toes, and good support for his insteps! With a size 14 shoe size, it has been quite a challenge for him to find comfortable footwear that are not only stylish, but comfortable. He said that he would love to get more Ugg footwear. His actual words were, "You can never have too many Uggs!" Perhaps this will mark the beginning of a beautiful new relationship with Uggs!
review.name: I would buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: They're not that comfortable & they're not as warm as I thought they'd be.
review.name: For the Price not worth it

review.reviewBody: I work outside doing snow removal, it doesn't take much for my feet to get cold and wet. It's hard to find boots that do both really well. I knew Ugg has a great reputation (my daughters have several) so I ordered them. Not only did my feet stay warm and dry but didn't even feel like I had boots on they were so comfortable. Highly recommend
review.name: Amazing snow boots

review.reviewBody: Beautiful pair of boots! Keeps your feet dry and warm. Highly recommend wearing a pair of warm cabin socks with them as the perfect combo and you're good to go to brace the harsh winter cold.
review.name: Stylish and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I purchased four pairs for two adults and two teens in my family and they have all loved the boot and report the boot is light in weight and very comfortable.
review.name: Great buy and they look good in person

review.reviewBody: I bought those shoes bc Ugg advertises them as waterproof shoes but 100% not those shoes are water-permeable do not buy from Ugg Liar company waste of money and time. I wanna add photos of my wet feet but there is no option on the application
review.name: Completely disasters purchase

review.reviewBody: I have w been wearing Saucony running sneakers for the past 5 years as an avid runner - Great comfort, cushion and stability…
review.name: Great comfort

review.reviewBody: I bought the Ride 16's a few months ago and have about 250 miles on them.  This is one of the best pair of running shoes I have ever used.  I bought my Ride 17's last month and I actually think this is a step up.  In both cases I bought a half size up from my street shoes and they fit me perfectly.  The 17's are comfortably padded without being squishy.  I used them for a couple of longer distance runs, ran several up tempo workouts and raced a 5k and felt totally comfortable each time.  I would not call the Ride 17 a racing shoe, but they can handle faster paces if needed.  They are a perfect addition to my rotation.
review.name: Perfect addition to my rotation!

review.reviewBody: I have about 30 miles on them.  Overall I am pleased with the choice.  The only drawback from the 5th star is an issue with the tongue of the shoe.  The inside part that is hidden inside the shoe does not seem to be sewn in and so scrunches up on the side of your foot when sliding in.  Both shoes so I believe it is in the design.  Other than that it is a pretty comfy ride.
review.name: Almost a 5

review.reviewBody:
bought this a month ago and here are my thoughts
1. style and color are excellent...cool looking shoe
2. performance--not narrow, lots of room to work with...lots of bounce but firm enough to stay stable on your movements.
great shoe overall...rivals the Hoka Clifton that i normally wear...like the Ride better than than the current clifton models...thanks Saucony
review.name: excellent choice for runners

review.reviewBody: This was my first purchase of the Ride 17, I wear these shoes all day and my feet feel great!!  Comfy and very supportive! Will purchase again!
review.name: Awesome Shoes!!

review.reviewBody: So far I have accumulated over 200 miles in these shoes. The upper is durable and breathable with no tears. Ran in the Texas heat and humidity and it still holding up. The lock down for me could have been better. On my right shoe, my heel kept slipping but my left side was secure. You can really feel the weight of the shoe; maybe because the midsole is very dense. The midsole took a decent amount of time to break in, at least 50 miles. I am also 190lbs with a muscular build. The midsole is by no means "plush" or "soft." It is firm with just a hint of softness. For stability, it was good but the wide base took some time to get use to. The transaction was smooth, landing on the midfoot is where the money is at. I wanted to like this shoe but the the midsole was not it. It felt like a brick on the first run. It needs to be a bit softer and lighter for my liking. I hope Saucony can tweak the next iteration.
review.name: Good But Not Great

review.reviewBody: not an improvement over the last Ride 17 I purchase.  First time jogging and it liked eating my socks.  It required my stopping 2 times.  Not happy
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: 5 star shoe except for the shoelaces. I don't know if my shoe just showed up after the OEM laces ran out or what, but there's barely enough lace to tie these puppies--and even then I have to cinch them pretty tight to borderline uncomfortable levels. But aside from all that, I've loved Saucony Rides almost forever. Great shoe.
review.name: 5 star shoe except for...
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback.

review.reviewBody: Training for a half marathon and these have been a game changer for everyday runs!
review.name: Perfect everyday runner

review.reviewBody: Second pair in less than a year, just because they fit and feel Great!
review.name: Ride 17 are Great

name: Ride 17 Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Merino Midweight hiker socks are nice and warm to wear in winter. I wear a pair of these socks with my boots almost everyday to work outside on the farm in the cold.
review.name: Merino midweight hiker socks are warm and comfortable.

review.reviewBody:
Love these socks!! Use them for my fly fishing trips in colder water. I also use them every morning on my 5 mile walk in my New Balance shoes. They keep my feet warm and have extra cushion. 
Great socks!!
review.name: My go to socks

review.reviewBody: As usual another awesome Simms product. I am a 9 1/2 shoe size, ordered large and the fit is perfect. Soft, yet feel durable.  Warm without bulk and they don't sag. Great socks!
review.name: great socks

review.reviewBody: I love these marino mid weight socks!  Super comfortable and just the right thickness to keep my feet warm but not interfere with the fit of my boots/shoes.  I started with 2 pair but I'll be buying more for the winter fishing season!
review.name: Very comfortable!

review.reviewBody:
great sock, wear them in cold weather for work.
Also great with my hiking boots on the trails
review.name: socks

review.reviewBody: Great fitting. Not itchy.  Excited to use them in Alaska
Very comfy. Just the right amount of stretch. Perfect thickness and density for hiking and they don’t bunch up.
review.name: A new favorite

review.reviewBody: These are both really great socks, but they are not the same.  The camo version is about 25% heavier.  I tend to reach for the camo under 30 degrees, but I have the volume in my boots to accommodate them.  Still, I would take either as the very best socks in my drawer.  They are durable, true to size, and very high quality.   Happy feet !
review.name: Great socks, but they are not the same !

review.reviewBody: One wouldn't think socks are a big deal, but keeping moisture away from your feet and your feet warm and dry is key. No more distractions on cold days,  110% focused now  on the next grab and ensuring the best chance of an epic  hook-up!!
review.name: The little details are important as the big details

review.reviewBody: Great socks!they are soft and warm and not itchy at all
review.name: Great socks

review.reviewBody: Every pair of EVERYWHERE pants and shorts I onw are absolutely amazing. Most versatile line of pants that I can use anywhere. Love them mostly for kayaking, climbing, hiking, playing drums, and almost anything else.
review.name: Best line of pants hands down!

review.reviewBody: If you need a tough short these might be okay but if you want a comfy travel, hiking and everyday activity, these are too rough.  Like sand paper.
review.name: Material is rough, not soft

review.reviewBody: Great shorts, very light and comfortable. The only negative I have for these shorts and other 686 pants are the pockets are a little shallow. Especially for clothing made for active people, I think the pockets should be a bit deeper since phones are getting bigger too. I bike to work and I always feel like my phone will slip out of the pocket when wearing 686 shorts/pants. Despite this "negative" point I do own multiple other pairs of 686 pants/clothing and find that they are quality made, very lightweight and comfortable.
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody:
About 9 months out of the year these shorts have seen weekly use for the last 4 years. These have become some of my favorite shorts I’ve ever owned. 

I’ve done tons of cycling in them and still not worn out. Fishing, kayaking, hiking, camping, yard work, you name it. Still going strong. 

Back pocket is a little bit stretched from keeping the wallet there. Stitching finally gave out on the pocket where it’s mean to hold a pocket knife clip. That’s from constant weight of a leatherman tho, and these being very light shorts. Both of those things have happened to basically all other pants/shorts I’ve had in one way or another. 

I would like to see the same fabric of the shorts used for the interior of the front pockets. 

Overall I’m beyond impressed with these and since my original purchase back in 2020 i now have a second pair of shorts and 3 pants. Keep up the great work!
review.name: 4 Year Review

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect shorts - had to pick up another pair. They're a great length and the weight and stretch of the fabric is great. Most shorts can't offer the feel of these without sacrificing pockets and/or they'll just look like board shorts or athletic shorts, not here.
review.name: Perfect shorts - had to

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the pants so much I had to get the shorts. Bought three pair and couldnt be happier.
review.name: Awesome pants and shorts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit great. Well built. Wish the front pockets were a bit deeper
review.name: Fit great. Well built. Wish

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have bought pants from them that have are comfortable and great quality. So i knew the shorts wouldn’t disappoint. Great comfort and quality craftsmanship. I have been wearing them to places via biking and hiking.
review.name: My Go-To Shorts Now

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The best shorts! The only shorts. Tons of pockets and they have a gusset that provides the dance floor your family jewels always needed.
review.name: I own 8 pairs of these shorts!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Same men's shorts I've previously ordered but the black color fits more tightly than my current beige and olive ones do. Not quiet as comfortable, but OK. A little disappointed considering the cost, and since I'll be traveling I won't have time to return them.
review.name: Does not fit to size

review.reviewBody:
I love the Ortovox Comp 120 series.  These leggings are insanely light, and amazingly comfortable!  Mine only weigh 2.6ozs for a size M.  Being 70% merino wool, that's pretty damn impressive! I wouldn't use them solely if your hiking/adventuring in crazy cold temps.. That said, for their weight, they do perform very well.  I've worn them in temps down into the low 30s/with crazy wind..  (under my UL hiking pants / Nylon)  and was perfectly fine. )
a great UL piece of gear for thruhiking!
review.name: Awesome UL Leggings!

name: 120 Comp Light Short Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: SB140 T3 X01 Eagle AXS 29in Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody: I'm about two months into riding the SB140 on PNW trails. Only two complaints. The first, my fork was borked ... leaking oil after each ride. After some attempts to fix, Backcountry stepped up and provided a replacement fork. The other complaint is that non-mtb nerds think this bike was made by a company that specializes in plastic coolers and aluminum tumblers. Once you get on the trail ... you won't mind. Climbs like an eeb. Handling is precise but requires a bit more weight over the front vs. driving from the back seat. Overall a dream ride for a mid-travel trail bike. 5 star bike and 5 star customer service from the Backcountry team.
review.name: Won't keep drinks cold, rips trails

review.itemreviewed: SB140 T3 X01 Eagle AXS 29in Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody: I’ve been riding this about three weeks now and love it. Suspension great
review.name: Fantastic bike

review.itemreviewed: SB140 T3 X01 Eagle AXS 29in Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody: The bike was perfect, arrived early, well packed, and the components were all ready to go. The communication ion was excellent. Will buy from backcountry again!  Thank you!
review.name: New yeti sb140 bike day

review.itemreviewed: SB140 T3 X01 Eagle AXS 29in Mountain Bike
review.reviewBody: My brother used to date this girl named Abby and we all thought she was a dud, but my brother continued to state that she was the coolest. Anyway, Abby came and went,  thank God but the statement “dude, she’s cool!” Has lived on and has been used to indicate when things are indeed quite cool. This bike rides and corners like a dream. Coming from a 27.5 I had ridden multiple 29ers and just couldn’t get them to corner. This thing rides better and corners better than I’m sure Abby did!! It’s light, reactive and bombs the downhill as good as my previous long travel did. If you’re on the fence you should just buy this bike, Abby would approve.
review.name: Dude, she’s cool!

name: SB140 T3 X01 Eagle AXS 29in Mountain Bike

review.itemreviewed: Rush 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love everything about this pair except one super important area: the toe box. 

I normally wear a 12.5 but “sized up” to a 13 (47) per suggestions. The right move - but maybe I need wide? The rest of the fit is great … just the toe box is more narrow than I’d like. Toes crossed for the 100 miles ahead.
review.name: Toe box is just a little too small

review.itemreviewed: Rush 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: If you want a lightweight hiking boot that still has some backbone, the Scarpa Rush 2 is a standout. This is the rare lightweight that can hold up to harder hikes, and I really like the traction on rockier trails. This is the lightest boot in the Rush series, and it's one of my two go-to recs for hikers looking for a legit lightweight hiking boot. Most U.S. hikers probably should size up one full size from their everyday shoes for the best fit.
review.name: One of the best lightweight hiking boots

review.itemreviewed: Rush 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Rush Mid 2 GTX fits better and is made of better material than its predecessor.  Throw out the stock foot beds and use superset. It runs small. I am a true 10.5 in most shoes and size 11 in Brooks running shoes. Got a 45 which fits well with good toe room.
review.name: Great fit, and little break in

review.itemreviewed: Rush 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just bought them and they light and comfortable perfect boot for day hiking!!!
review.name: Great light day hiking boot

name: Rush 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Remi Runner Leash
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fido Pro Remi Runner Leash online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Excellent product! We have a well-trained albeit energetic chocolate lab who spends a lot of time off-leash but sometimes needs to be corralled on busy trails. I love everything about the design of the Remi Runner. Each detail seems well thought out -- grab loop placement, d-ring for short roping, just the right tension in the bungee. The length is perfect, allowing Pete to enjoy being a dog with his nose to the ground without being underfoot. There's some fussing as you need to do some leash management, but most of the time it's hands-free which is dreamy.  I haven't used it backpacking, but other than adding something else around your waist, the webbing is flat and thin enough that I suspect it wouldn't be an issue at all. 10/10 would recommend.
review.name: Game changer!

review.reviewBody: You gotta do the work if you want the lowest price! This item is $10 cheaper on fido pro's website. Make sure you mention that within 48 hours of purchasing! Luckily the gearhead who helped me out was understanding and refunded me outside that window. Leash is solid. Super solid. Great purchase.
review.name: Lowest Price Guarantee??

name: Remi Runner Leash

review.reviewBody: These gloves worked well alone or as a liner with my down mittens. My hands tend to run very cold, but these helped cut the cold. However, they lasted about one year before 6 of the 10 fingers wore through. The tech strips wore off within a month or two. For the price, on sale, I'm okay with that, but I am going to look for a different pair to try this go around.
review.name: Decent glove

review.reviewBody:
Went to an a Co-op store that "believes a life outdoors is a life well-lived!" 
Couldn't find what I needed so bought these from Backcountry.
Need:
8 day vacation: London and Paris
Weather: 29-51 degrees
Born in Hawaii, grew up in California Bay Area. Lived in CO, Germany, Michigan for the Army and cold weather is NOT my style.
Bought these liners to use with my current gloves. On vacation, I ended up using these liners everyday to keep my hands warm and used my other gloves over them on a long day outdoors. They worked well and kept me from touching things (most folks in our group caught a cold).
Currently use these liners under my 3-season motorcycle gloves for my morning commute. They are great so I don't have to buy another pair of gloves that I may use 1/12 of the year. I wear the liners on my morning jogs/walks and work well. 

Four stars for fit, warmth, portability, and the multi-colored tab to pull the glove on.
One star taken off: while the index finger worked well with my iPhone, the thumb didn't. The material was not placed well for pinching or taking pictures.
review.name: Worked great for a cold vacation

name: Thermal Merino Glove

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: So far so good just like with all of my Salomon shoes
review.name: Very warm hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing Salomon low cut shoes for years hiking really big mountains. Some major concerns that I have to contend with on long, strenuous hikes above treeline is fatigue and potential injury. I was hesitant to try other styles due to additional weight, but that is a non issue with these, they support my ankles better, offer more protection while scrambling over boulders and still provide the lightweight performance I’ve come to appreciate.
review.name: Perfect all around hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The hook for the laces at top of boot popped off. This looks like a really bad design.  I have owned several pairs of Salomen X Ultra boots.  The Goretex model had a metal hook at top of laces.  Salomen has chnged the sizes of these boots.  The XUltra Goretex have moved from Vietnam to their Cambodia plant.  Way to narrow now for my feet.  The X Ultra mid is small but not to narrow (currently made in Vitnam plant). I needed 1/2 size bigger than my old boots.
Problems that need to addressed Salomen!
review.name: Hook at top of laces broke from boot
comment: Hi. For any inconvenience, we apologize. We're happy to reassure you that a case has been opened to address your worries, and we're looking forward to hearing from you. Check your inbox!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Nice comfortable shoe I’m big fan I have several pair
review.name: Great shoe

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: It is a pleasant experience to walk and ride on trails for several days in a row, they are very comfortable, light and work great on the trail and in the city. Excellent option and a great color and look.
review.name: Comfortable Security

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought this pair last moth, very good only thing it get to hot inside the shoe
review.name: Good shoe

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: So far so good. They are very comfortable and breathable. Feet don’t seem to sweat much. Waiting for it to rain to see how waterproof they are.
review.name: First review

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm impressed. I purchased these boots recently and used them, more or less out of the box, for an 8 day backpack trip (~30lb pack/~75 miles) in the Beartooth Mountains.  The fit is excellent.  They're light, stable, and protective. The traction is great.  The waterproof protection worked well. I can't speak to the long-term durability, but they've held up well so far.  My only complaint, and it's not a big deal,  is that they smelled pretty bad after the first day.  These are a serious upgrade after using trail runners for hiking and backpacking for many years...without much of a weight penalty.  Side note - I intended to purchase the X Ultra 4, but after trying both models on, I went with this boot because it fit better and felt more substantial, especially the sole.
review.name: Great so far

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: In one trip packing out a moose in alaska these shoes got completely soaked just from the rain (they absorbed water like a sponge) and one of them got cut open just from walking through the alders they are great for light work? Work shoes, I would not recommend for anything serious.
review.name: Catastrophic failure
comment: Hi. We’re sorry for any inconvenience. We’re glad to confirm to you that a case has been opened to address your concerns, and we’re waiting for your answer. Please check your inbox!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Salomon boots have NEVER let me down.  I've worn these in the deserts of far away dangerous countries and the trails I walk my pups on today.  There is absolutely zero hesitation on wearing Salomon in my world.  Great fit and finish.  Great product.
review.name: Quality + Comfort = Salomon

name: X Ultra 360 Mid CSWP Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Dura 3R Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Exped Dura 3R Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dura 3R Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Exped Dura 3R Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Just used this pad over a weekend in South Louisiana for the first time. Temps were in the low 50s, and I stayed perfectly warm in a 55 degree bag. 

First night I inflated the pad using the Exped Widget, which seemed to max out inflation significantly lower than the provided fill bag with the Schnozzle. 

I'm 5' 11" , 200 lbs., and a side sleeper. I found my hips compressing the pad to the point where my hips slightly touched the ground the first night. Second night I used the inflating bag to add more air to the pad, and that made night 2 much better. Plenty of support once I filled it more. 

Not sure how this would handle really cold temps, but for milder climates it seems great. It packs down small enough to take on paddle trips for sure. If you're backpacking and are counting ounces, you may look elsewhere.
review.name: Super comfortable, packs smallish

name: Dura 3R Sleeping Pad

hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Eliminator Grid Trail 2Bliss T7 29in Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I recently mounted these tires to a set of We Are One Union wheels and was surprised at how easy they were to mount using a high volume pump. I am running this as a rear tire and love how well it rolls considering the amount of grip on offer. Braking traction is excellent and on par with the Maxxis DHRII. 

If you're looking to breakaway from the same old tire combo you've been running for the least few years then seriously consider this tire. I expect this would be a great front tire for a fast-rolling trail bike and it is ideal as a rear tire on a trail/enduro bike. 

The cheery on top is the price. These tires are significantly more affordable than comparable tires options from other top-notch brands. If you give these a try you won't regret it.
review.name: Loving these tires

name: Eliminator Grid Trail 2Bliss T7 29in Tire

Once my husband figured out how to pull the top off the bladder was stuck together and I was afraid of tearing it. I found that really frustrating. Should at least have some pictures included with the pack. The water hose hangs down to my knees. Looks like there is something on the 7 that you can clip it to.

Other than that, I think I'll like the pack.

review.name: Bays 18L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
I live in a big city and don’t own a car so I live out of my bag when I’m not home. This means carrying an assortment of daily goods. This bad has plenty of room for my camera (inside of a padded camera cube), headphones, a book, laptop, and whatever else I might need for the day’s adventure. 

I’m probably what you’d call an over-researcher when it comes to things like this. I spent hours comparing bags online and in-person and ultimately landed on the Via 18 liter backpack. It just checks all of the boxes I had. 

I love the style, the size and the durability of this bag. Highly recommended.
review.name: A perfect everyday bag

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to love this backpack. I am obsessed with the color way. But functionally, It just doesn't work. 

Ill go into some details:
The backpack is really narrow and deep, both the main and front pocket. Maybe good for larger items, but it leaves an awkward amount of space “on top”- I. e, with a laptop inside, water bottle, or books, there is still like 8 inches of vertical bag space which makes fitting things weird. Could be good for fitting a jacket I suppose, but things like snacks, and smaller items just get sort of placed weird. The horizontal space gets filled top quick due to it being narrow. 

The front pocket is what made me return this bag. Because only zips horizontally across, and because the pocket is SO deep, I found this pocket to be really awkward to use. For reference of depth, when sticking my arm in it goes up to my elbow. 
Small things get lost in the cavern on the pocket. Large things don’t really fit due to the narrow zip. 

Maybe I just don’t have the use case of this design, but I couldn’t figure out any practical use for this bag.

Lastly, no water bottle pocket was kinda disappointing. 

Because of all of these issues, I couldn’t justify keeping the bag for its cost even though I really wanted to love it.
review.name: Beautiful, well constructed backpack. Awkward Design

review.reviewBody: I went with this bag because of design/brand rep. as well as the material. It’s just enough space for me in conjunction with a duffel bag (hint) which I’ll need next. I’ll report back after some use.
review.name: Coto Vaya 18L

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for my daughter for school. She’s been looking for a light, water resistant backpack with enough shoulder support for her laptop and space efficient for her school work. This bag meets all her needs and she’s loving it!
review.name: Great school bag

review.reviewBody: Perfect backpack for on the go. I ordered it for my job and it fits all the necessities: laptop, water bottle, planner, notebook, all the pens/pencils, wallet, & accessory bag filed with emergency goodies.
review.name: Great on the go

review.reviewBody: in the email, dont make me rewrite the review here. Great bag for short waisted folks.
review.name: I already wrote it

review.reviewBody: This bag arrived sooner than expected, allowing me to use it for a three-day trip to Chicago. It was fantastic! It fit everything I needed while giving room for any souvenirs I picked up. I also loved the bag's false bottom computer sleeve. I didn't have to worry about damaging my computer every time I set my bag down.
review.name: Excellent Bag!

review.reviewBody: I wanted this backpack to commute and take my laptop everyday in Mexico City, I am very Happy I found this Vaya 20L as I was looking for something durable and well made to carry my life's work which is my laptop and this backpack meets perfectly those needs, great resistant materials, construction is top noch, the laptop compartment is paded and suspended so it doesn't hit the ground. the front large pocket is great for my accessories, I also use this pocket for a water bottle, the pack does not have a side water bottle pocket so I use the front pocket and its actually better as there is no risk for the bottle to fall. lots of attachment points, comfortable straps and a very cool and clean design. I love this backpack and I highly recommend it.
review.name: Outstanding everyday Backpack

review.reviewBody: I love this backpack! It’s comfortable and durable, I use it for long hikes, and also for overnight trips.
review.name: Perfect little backpack

name: Vaya 18L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
First things first this is not an everyday all season wader. And not a wader I’d be hiking around to much in. You will roast in them in the spring and summer time in the lower 48. There is some breath ability but not much. This wader seems to be designed for cooler climates, cold water, and like it says expedition where durability is way more important than weight.

At 6ft 1in 175lbs. The MRM size fits perfect. Like a pair of pants with plenty articulation in the knees and crotch to hop in and out of boats. The material is bomb proof. The features are excellent, adjustable shoulder straps and upper torso allowed me to dial in the fit and stay dry.  Knee pads are something I never knew I needed and having them is a nice addition. My only two complaints are getting the rear yoke to slide up after you slide it down it’s kind of a pain. And the fleece lining in the feet. This is great idea at first. If you can dry them out. I spent a week in Alaska in them. And could never dry them fully and my feet were constantly wet. If there was an option to not have fleece lined neoprene I’d definitely go that direction.
review.name: Is this the best wader on the market?

review.reviewBody: Had these waders for 2 years now fishing on and off from 2-3 days a week and taking 4-5 trips a year and i love these! they have been super durable im not the nicest to my gear and dont mind sliding down hills on my butt and am always kneeling down to handle fish and havnt had a single leak yet! i would say my only gripe is the inseam fit like most people say. i have found if you properly adjust the shoulder straps especially in the back which helps the butt come down and the fit wont be so tight other than that i love them!
review.name: Great High End Wader

review.reviewBody: Worn these many times and they fit great and feel durable. I highly recommend.
review.name: Absolutely awesome

review.reviewBody: understand Patagonia does not have a lifetime warranty.  it is a warranty for the life of the product--they determine what that lifetime of the item should be.  Do not buy patagonia!
review.name: flyfisher

review.reviewBody:
I'm 5'11" 185 pounds with a 32x32 pant size.  The medium fits perfect but for sure a trimmer fit.  It's funny, the complaints I heard about the previous versions, rio Gallegos and the like were that they fit like garbage bags (too baggy).  Seems like with all of the size options you can really choose your fit.  

I burn through waders like no one's business since I fish 3-5 times a week and only walk and wade.  These have shown no sign of wear and are very sturdy.

I love the knee pads, the pockets, the fit, but most of all the suspender drop feature.  Makes doing your business a lot easier and I drop them down when Id usually wear waist high waders.  

Try em out, if they don't fit, try a different size.  Trimmer lower section guys will be very happy with these.
review.name: Awesome and built to last

review.reviewBody: Wouldn't recommend these due to the crotch fit. The cut needs to be rethought, Patagonia, especially for the asking price. Tried two size of these (LLL and MRL) and the MRL fit better (more fitted of course because of the smaller size) but regardless of choosing long or regular for the length the waders just don't fit right. Maybe it's the gusseted crotch? I know the intent is to provide  freedom of movement and a more comfortable wearing experience....but Patagonia failed here. Tried Orvis Pro waders out and the cut is superior, although the materials don't feel as durable as these. The should strap system makes these a pain to get in and out of - buckles would provide an improved experience.
review.name: High quality, but poor crotch fit

review.reviewBody:
I don't mean tight in a good way. I bought these in two sizes LRL and LLL. Both were lacking in the crucial area during normal walking. Squatting was ironically the most comfortable aspect of wearing these waders. Otherwise, the inside of the crotch just crushes your cashews with each stride. If I were DJ Khalid, I would say you played yourself. Very disappointed Patagonia, how do you scrap the great fit from the Rio Gallegos and Skeenas (both of which I own) for whatever cut it is you dropped with these Expeditions. I'm very average in the lower lot so no, I'm not pounding my chest. Also, your new shoulder strap system sucks. 

This is a copy-pasta from the Patagonia site. Guaranteed they won't appreciate the honest response and refuse to publish it, but then again I would delete a review like this if it performed a deep squat all over my precious new wader line.
review.name: SUPER TIGHT, BRAH!!

name: Swiftcurrent Expedition Waders - Men's

review.reviewBody: Thong pulled free from sandal after 14 months, unfortunately 2 months after the warranty period.
review.name: I would not buy again.

review.reviewBody: This sandal fits well and is comfortable for me. I have bought several.
review.name: Great Sandal

review.reviewBody: I purchased three pairs of Parajo sandals (all Turkish Coffee) in the last year, and none of them lasted. The last pair - lasted me only a month before they separated. I wish they would allow me to post photos so all who read this can see. Pros: Comfortable. Look Good. Cons: Poor Quality. Teva Warranty - You have to jump through too many hoops to return them so they can be inspected to see if they qualify under warranty. For me, it isn't worth the time, and that is if you have a receipt. Neutral: I am normally a size 9.5 or 10. I had to size down to a size 9 for the best fit. With different manufacturers and sometimes with the same manufacturer - you will have to size up or down - this is usually a result of how the shoes/sandals/boots are made and how they are supposed to fit. Overall: I expect my sandals to last at least a year, yet I have gone through three (3) Teva Parajo's while my Keen Waimea H2 sandals are still going strong after almost four years, and they have toe protection (huge bonus). I have been a Teva supporter since 1990 - this ended with my last pair of Parajo's. The quality is not the same as it once was, and neither is the service.
review.name: Don't buy these - there are better sandals out there.

review.reviewBody: I use every day. Very comfortable and great support
review.name: I would buy this product again

review.reviewBody: Great sandal!!! Has really good arch support, good traction with the sole, and straps are wide & comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Flylow made bibs for the ladies and only put TWO pockets in?!? Didn't even put one on each leg. My husband has FL men's bibs and has SEVEN pockets. Fit is mediocre at best (5'10, 150lbs, was inbetween M and L and went with L so I could layer up), but at least they're long enough. They are durable and the waterproofing is good. The seat zipper is good in concept, but not well executed and difficult to use with baselayers on. I feel like these bibs could be better, especially for the price.
review.name: Only 2 pockets?!?!

review.reviewBody: i love these bibs.  they aren't insulated so i pair them with the Backcountry Wolverine Cirque 3/4 Insulated Pant.  they hang well and aren't too long or bunchy around the ankles.  I love the idea of the seat zipper, but it is a struggle with high-waisted base layers so i just undo the bibs.
review.name: love them

review.reviewBody:
For reference: measurements 35/26/39

I tried on so many bibs and ski pants this winter and these were fine. I think if I hadn't tried 10 others, these would have been great! I just liked the fit, zippers, and fabric on others much more. In comparison to the moxie/foxy fabric, these just weren't as nice. I wore these with a thicker wool baselayer and they fit well, great range of motion. I'm a 4/6 in jeans.
review.name: Liked, did not love

review.reviewBody: I have base layers from most major players: Arcteryx, Icebreaker, Patagonia. They each have their uses, but the HH Lifa is my go to, all around, hands down fav. I?ve been wearing them for years hiking and backpacking (and even at the gym) in all seasons. Nothing works better for keeping my skin dry while exerting. They are the quintessential wicking base layer. Adjust for temp/season with your overlayer(s) and get out there. The fit, at least for me, is true next to skin. That and the material is what makes them so effective. But it may not be the most flattering of looks.     I know. But so what. They just work! Follow the washing Inst. and they will last a long time. Enjoy.
review.name: Love the Lifa

name: Lifa Stripe Crew Top - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Rubino Pro G2.0 Limited Edition Clincher Tire
review.reviewBody: Was looking for an inexpensive natural sidewall tire...these were $24.99.  Read a review that said they run narrow...so bought 25mm.  Put on my 23mm wide (outside dimension) rims, and they inflated to 29mm - pretty fat, but fit great in my 2017 Fuji SL Elite.  Ride great, and took them up and down Sassafras Mountain (SC) and over to Brevard (NC) via See Off Mtn & Becky Mtn Roads.  Be sure to not overinflate, as with a lot of volume effective pressure at the rim wall is very high even at 90 psi!  Liked them so much, wanted a less wide pair for an older "tight clearance" frame (2007 BLUE RC7) - a snug fit as the 25mm inflated to 26mm on 24mm wide rims (outside width).  So ordered 2 more sets of 25mm (figure can't mix-and-match and keep a cool look like you can with all black tires...at this price, might as well keep some on hand).  May stick the 28's on my 1985 Bianchi Trofeo as it has lots of clearance.  Rode the 25mm on the local race pace group ride and no problems.  My high end tires are 320 tpi, but at 150 tpi these are still a nice ride (remember that a lot of high end tires are at this or below...127 tpi being a common thread count).  I am an old dude (over 60) and have ridden a lot of different bikes and tires and wheel combos...so am pretty happy with the price and performance of this tire...though I have only been riding them for about a month (the 28's) and have only 4 rides of about a total of 200 miles on the 25's.
review.name: 28mm and 25mm widths

review.itemreviewed: Rubino Pro G2.0 Limited Edition Clincher Tire
review.reviewBody: I have used the all black versions of this tire (700x25mm) for several years and found them to be very durable. I typically get a year's worth of road miles, about 6,000, per set. The skin wall limited edition Rubino Pro tires are no different, and I really like their classic looks for my vintage steel road bike.
review.name: Vittoria Rubino Pro Limited Edition

review.itemreviewed: Rubino Pro G2.0 Limited Edition Clincher Tire
review.reviewBody: I purchased my 5th pair of vittoria rubino pros, since they have been a very good reliable dependable tire. However this last set I purchased was the worst tire I have had. In 31 days I had 5 flats. I had to restock my tube inventory. I hadn't had a flat in months with my old set of rubinos. With the new set I had a flat the second ride with them installed. Then I had a simultaneous front and back flat at the same time. Then I had a rear flat 2 times on 1 ride. I checked the tires for anything that might be stuck like glass or something. Nothing. So not sure if just this set was bad. I installed an old pair of gp 5000s I had sitting here. No flats so far. So it's not the rim tape or the wheel.
review.name: Bad set of tires?
comment: The casings on these are rock solid, but the bead is very tight/rigid. I regularly puncture at least one tube getting a pair of these on. I?m guessing, but not accusing, that you may be pinching or otherwise compromising your tubes during the install resulting in flats during your ride.

name: Rubino Pro G2.0 Limited Edition Clincher Tire

review.reviewBody: I bought this crossbody last March, and I use it every single day! It has traveled across the country and abroad with me, and has held up perfectly! It holds the small Kanken wallet, phone, keys, snacks, chapstick, purell, AirTag, and still has some room to spare. I love it so much!!!
review.name: Best Bag EVER

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my 24 year old daughter for her birthday.  She keeps telling me how much she loves it.  She can fit a phone, wallet, chapstick, hand sanitizer, ,etc.  She says it is perfect for her needs. For reference, she is very petite, and the size of the bag fits her well.
review.name: Great, roomy bag!

review.reviewBody: Smaller than expected.  Looks much bigger on the model shown.
review.name: Smaller

review.reviewBody: I bought this 2 years ago for a diaper bag & hip seat I didn’t have to lug around for quick outings. It fits 2 diapers with wipes, phone, a few snacks, and all the essential cards - much more function than anticipated.  I have been using it consistently as an assisted carry/hip seat for a toddler and a baby and the buckle has never popped off. The yellow ochre colour has dirtied a bit but comes clean if it starts to bother me. Very happy with the purchase
review.name: Very Satisfied

review.reviewBody: I’ve owned this pack for about a year and I love it. It’s the perfect size to carry what I need everyday, and easily expands to be a crossbody bag, which is how I wear it. I’m back to buy it in another color.
review.name: Perfect everyday bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a gym fanny pack to hold my gloves and phone so my pants dont have too much weight in the pockets and its perfect for what im using it for
review.name: Gym pack

review.reviewBody:
I’ve loved all Fjallraven products that I’ve purchased in the past and this kanken hip pack is no exception. 
It fits everything I need including my kobo! I love the fabric and the colour, so much so that I want to get another in a different colour!. I highly recommend this bag for every day use
review.name: I LOVE this bag

review.reviewBody: Was hesitant about this bag especially considering the price, but i’ve been using it practically daily for over a year. Absolutely amazing for daily wear and travel, shocking how much you can fit in. Couldn’t recommend it more!!
review.name: Best Purchase Ever

review.reviewBody: This is my go to bag for the gym. I put my phone, wallet, airpods and car keys and it works with the added back and front pockets. I carry the bag across my shoulder and it's nice cause I don't have to get a locker to put my valuables in. Love this little bag.
review.name: Great little gym bag

review.reviewBody: I recently took this pack on a three week trip throughout Ecuador, from the beach, to the mountains, to the city. It kept my everyday carry items organized and safe. The zippers are great for my use, not too noisy. No, it's not waterproof, but the pack also zips up nicely underneath a raincoat. My phone only fits in the main compartment, but having the front pouch, the back pouch, and the internal flap help keep things neatly divided and safely sperate. The top handle is also a great anchor for temporarily hooking other items with a carabiner to stay hands free. I also have the Ulvo med Hip Pack for more rigorous activities when needed as it is more geared for adventure activites.
review.name: Great Everyday Pack

name: Kanken Hip Pack

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was between the Speedgoat and Mafate Speed, and am happy with the Mafate Speed. I run on mixed surface of gravel and more technical trails, and the grip is perfect for both. I also feel like there is enough cushion for road if needed. I am typically a 9 in running shoes and find Hoka runs a half size big.
review.name: Great for trail & gravel

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Good support, balance and traction on dirt trails.
review.name: Great trail shoe

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Third time is charm. A bigger size finally sealed the deal. Usually wear 10 women's. Final choice is an 11. No sign of tightness across top of shoe. The initial pulling of fabric looked like a problematic future to me. I want them for the mega grip sole. 70 year old woman in purple shoes is gonna look kind of crazy. Where I live the winters are pretty wet and want no slippery sole shoes. Of course these are cushy and nice. I have a pair or Gortex Transports which I like but they're not quite as cushy. I love the Clifton 9. Wish they'd put a mega grip sole on them. That vibram mega grip sole is a very much wanted asset to any shoe. Happy here.
review.name: Vibram mega grip sole.

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really like the style and color. Not enough insole for my arch as I would like. Added scholls insole and fit better for insole. Although now. Toes are higher just barely but didn't realize I raise my big toes up so much and the click on the seam
review.name: Mandate speed 4 purple

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I only wear HOKA and I've been wearing HOKA for over 5 years. This is an expensive trail shoe. I had the purple pair before the coral/pink pair both size 7.5. The purple pair ran shorter in length and shoe laces. The coral/pink pair run almost a half size bigger. Shoe laces are longer. When running downhill, you will fill your foot slip forward do to the extra length. I love the coral/pink color and currently thinking about returning them due to the length and seeing if a size down would help. I constantly worry if I am going to slip in them.
review.name: Colors Vary in Toe Box Room/Shoe Laces

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I LOVE these shoes for trail running!!!! These shoes are very comfortable right out of the box and grippy on all kinds of surfaces. I have a very difficult foot that isn't happy with most shoes, but these worked so well for me. Even though I'm a petite female, I have a wide foot and can easily get neuromas, but these shoes are working extremely well for me. I think that they would still work well for a narrower foot too due to because of the materials and structure of the shoe. Happy running and hiking! :)
review.name: Will buy these again for sure!! Awesome trail running shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wear my Mafate Speed 4 for comfort and arch support as I walk and run through my community, track, and park trails.
review.name: I'm glad that I made the purchase, in spite of the price!

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have experienced foot pain recently and stopped running for months. I bought these shoes and am running with no pain! These are the best running shoes I have ever owned! I only run 3 miles 3 days a week and these are perfect to keep me running!
review.name: Best running shoes ever owned!

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I almost returned these because the material on top, near the toe wasn't normally something I'd go for but the more I tried them on and wore them around the house the more I liked them. They didn't take any time to break in and they're actually really cool.
review.name: Almost returned but decided I liked them

review.itemreviewed: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have owned two other pairs of Hokas and have loved them for my trail hikes, but this is by far the best pair yet! The cushion I feel every time I step is so comfortable, they are literally springy. The tread on the bottom of the shoes is fantastic. Plus they look great!
review.name: Best trail shoes EVER!

name: Mafate Speed 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Sizing was correct in the waist but the snap closure completely sucked and popped open with the slightest pressure. Returned.
review.name: Worst short purchase yet

review.reviewBody: Coming off a pair of patagonia lightweight shorts, these are pretty similar, but fit me in the waist/hips better...and while the fabric is lightweight and welded seams are super nice, I have not had issues or pilling and I have had them for 6 months, probably 50 hours in them! impressive new offering from TLD. I sit between a 30 and 32, but with the slim style and stretch, I opted for the 30's
review.name: wow

review.reviewBody: Poor quality, do not recommend buying. The seam on the inner thigh completely ripped when I sat down in my truck on my way to go out riding! Only wore these a handful of xc rides and never crashed in them or caught them on anything.
review.name: Poor Quality
