review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and excellent for miles of walking. Newest pair is a darker look than my first which my wife says is more versatile. I use an orthotic insert for custom arch support and to keep plantar fasciitis at bay.
review.name: My second pair of Cliftons

review.reviewBody: these are by far the best walking shoes I ever tried on after the first eight hours. I felt no pain fast-forward to 20 hours on my feet. No pain.
review.name: Best shoes ever!!!!!!

review.reviewBody: After ordering a pair, I was amazed by the immediate comfort-they feel like walking on clouds, and the arch and heel support is perfect. I love the upgrades from the 8th version, and after trying one pair, I bought another in the wide version. These shoes are fantastic for daily wear or easy runs.
review.name: From Daily Wear to Easy Runs

review.reviewBody: This is my tried and true running shoe. Light enough to go fast, soft enough to go far while still being stable.
review.name: THE shoe

review.reviewBody: Very nice project, suggestion is specific cussing in nee area and light weight products
review.name: If necessary I will purchase again and again

review.reviewBody: After my wife talked non-stop about her new Hokas, I decided to join her in footwear paradise by getting a pair of my own. Wow- just...WOW! I have never had such comfortable shoes. I am creating excuses to wear them at every opportunity. I set multiple alarms during the night just so I can get out of bed, bust out my Hokas, and walk down the street to the all-night Quickie Mart for snacks.
review.name: Like walking on pillows!

review.reviewBody: Before these shoes working gave me a really bad pain under my feet but now the pain is gone. They are so comfortable!
review.name: They feel awesome

review.reviewBody: I love my new Clifton 9 shoes. Super comfortable and supportive. Hoka's are the best brand I've ever used. I would never go back to any other brand.
review.name: Fantastic shoes

review.reviewBody: Work standing all day and for first time my feet didn't hurt at end of day. Very comfortable shoes
review.name: Definitely buy again

review.reviewBody: Great for walking. It feels like you're walking on air.
review.name: Most Comfortable Sneaker Ever

name: Clifton 9 Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Purchased size 26 for my 9 1/2 yr old son who is ~ 74lbs thin build, and they fit great. He loves them for biking. They have good stretch and adjustability, and I was able to get them clean of mud and grease.  Buy them for the shorts, not the chamois. The one that they come with is a thin, nondescript piece of foam.  My son is happy enough with this for a 1-2 hour ride.  But it wasn't really about that so I am still giving this 5 stars, and will look for upgraded chamois liners for underneath when needed.
review.name: Good quality and stretch

review.reviewBody:
Great short so far! I love the inseam length and the pocket for snack/phone is in the perfect spot. Not to mention the material has great moisture wicking!

It does run a little big, so I would size down if you are in between sizes

Definitely recommend.
review.name: Great short! And perfect pocket placemen

review.reviewBody:
These shorts are fantastic for gravel and XC bike rides. They have a large comfortable elasticated waist panel which means that they stay in place without falling down as you are riding! Why don't more brands do this!

The knee length is great for me - sit just on my knee (I've short legs) avoiding sunburn & providing protection without looking overly long.

I'm definitely in the market for a second pair now. Can we have some more colours too please 🙏
review.name: Amazing shorts - I need a second pair now!

name: Cinder Crank Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: My title says it all, this has been my standard belay device carabiner for the past twenty years. Love it.

review.reviewBody: I am in charge of our chair evac equipment and have found the Twistlock Carabiners to be an excellent choice when in need.

review.reviewBody: I love my new carabiner. I actually thought I was buying the less expensive model, which is what I originally wanted, but I had no way of actually knowing not being a rock climber and everything. I personally bought these just lug around my keys and I love the twist lock

review.reviewBody: This carabiner is very light yet solid. Absolutely a great biner for your ATC or similar.

review.reviewBody: Super reliable, lightweight, easy to use. Just wish my hands were slightly larger so it would be easier to use the auto-lock one-handed. I’ve tried smaller ‘biners— but really need this size for the rigging I’m usually doing. No complaints on the gear- just know that if you have small hands, they can be harder to use single-handed.

review.reviewBody: Smooth action and solid construction lets your mind rest easy that this thing will last

review.reviewBody: Awesome twist lock carabiner. I use it glacier guiding up in alaska. I’ve used it in all types of weather: rain, snow, glacial silt and in freezing conditions. Very reliable. Smooth twisting.

review.reviewBody:
Love this carabiner for
- belaying from above
- rappelling on a munter 

It’s smooth, it autolocks. What more can you want?!
review.name: Smooth operator

hasVariant.description: Buy the Orvis Pro Approach Shoe - Men's online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
In the past on backpacking/flyfishing trips I've relied on Drainmakers which did well, but would fall apart after a couple trips. On a recent high mountain stream trip I tried these Orvis Pro Approach shoes and could not be happier. I wore wool liner socks and did not experience any rubbing/chafing others have mentioned. 

What really impressed me is that when my hiking boot soles came apart, I backpacked in these shoes for 15 miles on rough-rocky trails and they help up beautifully. Soles look great, no major issues.  Very happy and will replace with the same - whenever that may be because these shoes are tough!
review.name: Reliable, grippy, light, & comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Bought them for a wet-wade trip to WY.   Within a couple of hours, both heals had grooves in the Achilles tendon - not a "blister" but a groove in the flesh.  It's been a week and they're still not healed up.   Read up on these on the Orvis site and see their reviews - not good and i should have listened.   I wore them without socks/booties and they tore up my feet.   In the past, i'd wear some booties with my Simms boots and had no issues/blisters.   These went back and i'll stick with what i've been using.   Orvis' website rec's using some 5 mm neoprene socks with these, but what's the point?
review.name: Yikes.

name: Pro Approach Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great fit, love the fangs to hold my headlamp, adjustable for many heads
review.name: Light and fitting

review.reviewBody: I have a large head and this helmet fits very well. Adjustability is quick and easy, and its very comfortable! The feature to secure a headlamp is great and works very well
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody:
I finally upgraded from the old hard hat style helmet I bought in 2005.
This is so nice and light. 
The ratchet adjuster in the rear makes it fast and simple to adjust if I’m lending it to anyone else in the climbing party. 
Rear bungee holds to hold your headlamp in place, along with the plastic tabs!
review.name: Excellent lid to protect your head!

review.reviewBody: This helmet has disrupted the price:performance ratio of helmets, delivering outstanding quality and functionality at a very reasonable price point. The interior of this model seems the same as the MIPS model, minus the MIPS yellow insert; leaving some empty space, IMO. I simply filled those spaces in with cushiony Velcro pads from "The Depot" and got myself a sweet customized fit. It has wonderful comfort, super light, looks "cool" and seems like it would take a beating. My only regret is not getting it in my favorite color - Yellow. But with it on, I don't know what color it is anyway, right? Recommend highly!
review.name: Game Changer

review.reviewBody: Pretty light helmet and adjustments make it fit nice and snug on your head
review.name: Super light

review.reviewBody: So far so good. I’ve used the helmet a couple of times and it’s very comfortable, feels high quality, and very lightweight. Would recommend if you’re in the market for a helmet
review.name: Capitan climbing helmet

review.reviewBody: It’s my new favorite helmet! It’s very comfortable and I love the color!
review.name: Captain is great!

review.reviewBody: I got the orange color to be visible in the mountains. As a guide, having gear which can survive regular use while being hauled around and mentoring clients is essential. This is a replacement for a prior BD helmet which had a great, long life. Plan to keep using BD helmets (and much of the rest of their gear) for quality and durability!
review.name: Durability and visible

review.reviewBody: This helmets is light and quite adjustable. The tightener is not quite as easy as a dial, I find it easier to do when it’s not on my head. I bought the pink and blue and the colours are awesome. Vibrant! Would buy again.
review.name: Comfortable and Lihhtweight

review.reviewBody: The S/M fits small heads comfortably that many other helmets don't.
review.name: Durable and comfortable

name: Capitan Helmet

review.itemreviewed: 1927KW Lined Premium Grain Pigskin Palm Glove + Knit Wrist
review.reviewBody: I use them for skiing
review.name: Amazing

review.itemreviewed: 1927KW Lined Premium Grain Pigskin Palm Glove + Knit Wrist
review.reviewBody: I've had Kincos for years and have always loved them so I thought I'd pick these up and see if they were as good as the rest. Before these, I had always skied with the Lined Heavy-duty glove. These are more flexible making them a lot easier to use but in turn, they weren't as warm. Still an amazing glove especially with a liner inside but built more for a warm ski day and not a cold day in the backcountry. If your hands are always hot or you are fine using liners these could be a perfect all-year glove but if you are prone to the cold id recommend the mittin or the heavy-duty or premium gloves. Also don't forget to get some snow seal or something to waterproof these!
review.name: Love these gloves!!!

name: 1927KW Lined Premium Grain Pigskin Palm Glove + Knit Wrist

review.reviewBody: I have used this jacket in many conditions since I bought it, from windy cold days to torrential downpours.  I have had many such jackets over the years and this is by far the best. It kept me dry and warm during a one hour cold downpour, where other jackets let in the rain after a few minutes.  I liked the tapered fit and bright orange color.  A little heavier than some ultra light windbreakers I have owned, but it still folds up very small.  Furthermore I now realize that the ultra light windbreakers don't block the wind very well, like this one does.  I don't often get excited about cycling clothes but I am really delighted with this jacket.
review.name: Highly versatile jacket

review.reviewBody: The jacket is advertised as "packable," but that's misleading. You can indeed roll it up, find a band of some sort to hold it together and fit it in the back of a jersey. But at this price it should include a small attached pouch into which you can fit the entire jacket.
review.name: adequate, somewhat "packable"

review.reviewBody:
I got a size L, 6 feet, 174 pounds. 
It is easily stuffed in a back pocket. When I did have to use it I found it a bit too loose and flapped in the wind too much. I could tell it slows you down. I try to avoid putting it on since then.
review.name: Not Aero

name: Emergency 2 Rain Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: The bed on these sandals is so well designed!  It comforts my feet all day long. The web straps are perfectly placed and adjustment is easy. Love them!!
review.name: Great sandals every day!

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love them but the fabric piece on the lower strap keeps curling in on itself making them uncomfortable at times to wear
review.name: Pretty good

review.reviewBody: I really like the wide, soft straps. I wear back strap Birkenstocks every day, so these feel very familiar. They are great on uneven terrain. The soles handle rocks and steep inclines amazingly well. They are my new goto for hiking on dry trails or sloshing through watery places of boating. My only complaint is that the buckles are bulky and occasionally get caught on things, or get pushed into the tops of my toes. On the positive side, I like to wear the straps loose, whichi works fine with these. The way you have sewn the ends of thes straps so they don't pull out and come undone is very smart.
review.name: Like Trail-worthy Birks

review.reviewBody: Let’s just say I had my doubts about how these sandals look yet I have to say the function infinity outweighs any reservations about the form. I’ve guided on the Middle Fork of the Salmon for over two decades now and my hat is off to these sandals. They are the best full fit river sandals on the market, period. Get over how they look, get them on your feet , and you’ll know what I’m talking about. I actually insist my trainees get a pair for low water season.
review.name: Pure function!

review.reviewBody: These sandals are very comfortable, easy to put on, and versatile for walking in and out of the water.
review.name: Great sandals with style.

review.reviewBody:
Mine has giant buckles that don't appear to be the same as in the photos?
That and the foot bed is VERY weirdly narrow. 
Otherwise, I like the general concept. They work as a slid, with a heal that can be pulled on for better security. Im not sure if they are comfortable for long walks yet or not.
review.name: Giant buckles and VERY Narrow

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had a pair of the Webbers since June 2023 but before that I had a pair of the PFD sandals for over a year. As a stay at home dad I wore the PFDs for every thing and all 4 seasons - rafting, hiking, around town, grocery shopping, you name it and I wore them for the occasion. I retired my hiking shoes for grass cutting and other safety measures. The only thing I didn’t like about the PFDs was the way the buckle cut into my foot when I was kneeling down to tie a kids shoe but that was more on me than the sandal. 
When I first tried on the Webbers I was reluctant to like them because I was so used to the snug fit of the PFDs. I took them out West for a month long road trip to Montana with the family. Usual activities of day hiking, state fairs, water play on the the Yellowstone, Madison and Gallatin rivers, dining out, etc. and the Webbers became the new go to sandal. I still used my PFDs for rafting with the snugger fit and keeping small rocks out while in the water. 
I highly recommend these sandals for everyday wear if you consider shoes Foot Prisons like I do. Comfortable out of the box. Great fit for wide feet like mine and the ability to adjust the straps for a high instep is perfect. Of all the Astral footwear I have owned since the first Gen Brewers the PFD and the Webber have fit my foot type the best.
review.name: Ultimate Dad Adventure Sandal

review.reviewBody: My new favourite rain or shine sandals that keep me comfortably surefooted and my toes fancy free, in and out of the water.
review.name: Durable, dependable and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I have over 3,500 river miles and recently took the Webber M's on A 7 day Main Salmon. I was really  hoping these would be my go to river shoes but after 2 days I switched back to my Chacos. The GOOD-super comfortable from the moment I put them on. Astral hit a hole run with the foot bed. The BAD-the straps and buckles are just too wide and the build up of material around the edges prevents rocks from being able to flush out of the shoe. Also the large straps and chunky material never dried out. I really hope Astral continues to improve these sandals. With a few minor tweaks they would be amazing!
review.name: So Much Potential

review.reviewBody: First off, I love these sandals! They are comfortable and breathable. I ordered a size twelve, and the length was spot on, but it was a tad tight, but after a few wears and floats, they fit perfectly now.
review.name: Comfortable and Breathable

name: Webber Sandal - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Arcus BUGrip GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I immediately appreciated the fit and feel on these shoes when trying them on. Despite the durable, waterproof construction and tough soles, they felt light and roomy. With a lack of snow and ice on the streets, I took these for a few trail runs where I new there was some  early season snow and frozen mud and the grip was outstanding! They absolutely cruised up steep sections with the icy mud, and didn't slide a bit on the slushy snow. Looking forward to running in these this winter!
#BackcountryGearhead
review.name: Great Fit & Grip!

review.itemreviewed: Arcus BUGrip GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Having no worries about traction this winter is a huge plus! One of the scariest things of winter running can be slipping and falling, good to know icebug has my back.  These fit great with plenty of room for my toes to spread out, they run true to size.  For a goretex shoe, they are quite breathable as well.  I love the all black look, no issues on trail or around town! 

#backcountrygearhead
review.name: Ready For Winter!

review.itemreviewed: Arcus BUGrip GTX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got these shoes and they are very breathable. Usually when I start running or working out my feet start getting really hot but with these shoes my feet have room to breathe! Highly recommend these shoes.
review.name: Very Breathable

name: Arcus BUGrip GTX Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: UPDATE: It sucks.  I've had it on the bike for about a month. It turns yellow and loses its tackiness FAST. It was not cheap, but I have to take it off and replace it. 5 stars down to 1. This tape sucks! //// Here's my previous review, after I first wrapped it: I love the tape. Reviews say it's hard to wrap. I'm a relative beginner at tape wrapping, and I see why they are saying that, It tends to pucker. But with a little patience, I wrapped mine smoothly in less than 30 minutes.  It's sticky, but not overly so. It's more cushy than its thickness accounts for. All in all, it's a good tape. I prefer Arundel Silicone. But this is decent.
review.name: Waste of $, Even on Sale

name: Nastro Fiore Bar Tape

review.reviewBody: I have four pairs and wear them constantly. Great fit, great durability, and super comfortable. I basically live in these!
review.name: Favorite pants

review.reviewBody: I got these for my husband. True to size, comfortable and functional.
review.name: Great everyday pants

review.reviewBody: The epic tough yet great looking simple field pants
review.name: Rugget with style

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing these for a few weeks now pretty heavily. They are durable, fit well and are comfortable. They feel like a pair of jeans and have a bit of stretch to them. The only downside is that the waist is less stretchy, so when you are hiking or climbing, the legs, and the rest of the pant stretches as you move, but the waist stays pretty snug so you feel it during the activity.
review.name: Comfortable and Durable

review.reviewBody: Hello, I love OR but the fabric used for these pants do not meet OR's normal quality standard. Warn and washed just twice, I noticed disintegrating fabric and holes at both the front and back of the pant. Very poor quality cotton. The design of the pants is otherwise good.
review.name: The fabric is disintegrating- worn twice

review.reviewBody: These have become my go-to everyday pair. Durable, they've stood up to yard work, mechanic work, and all chores in between. They hold up alongside my duluth and carhartt pants any day, but with much more comfort. Comfort is the biggest appeal, I can wear them while climbing all over and not feel any binds or chaffing. They might run a little hot, being denim, but up to about 75 degrees they felt comfy. Last point is style, they look good, they feel good. I'm 5'8 170lbs for reference.
review.name: Best All-Around Jeans

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wear these all the time! The fit is amazing, not too baggy and not overly tight. Got them in multiple colors!
review.name: Love. These. Pants.

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) 34 x 32 fit is great for 185cm, 86kg. pants are comfortable and look good. a nice intermediate between chinos and work pants. very happy and will likely purchase another pair.
review.name: great pants

review.reviewBody: Purchased one pair and loved the fit! So bought 2 more pair. My only complaint is the seam on the lower leg is twisted on all 3 pair. I wear them alot and even hiked in them a few times. Pocket on the side leg holds a cell phone perfectly.
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: Sturdy pants that would be too hot for real outdoor activities but excellent for everyday use (what I bought them for). 5'11 wearing 32 all the time, I bought the size 32 but I usually do best with shorter inseam (30''), so these were definitely too long. But that's OR's pants' problem in general : inseam is always a bit too long for those with legs on the shorter side.
review.name: Great sturdy everyday pants

name: Goldbar Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Explorer III Slip-On WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for winter boots that would be easy to put on and take off. These boots are all that plus lightweight, comfortable, and warm. The salt color is a lovely alternative to basic black.
review.name: Just what I wanted!

review.itemreviewed: Explorer III Slip-On WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the style, but can't get the boot on my foot. Please listen to feedback and add a zipper. Returned.
review.name: Needs a zipper
comment: Hello Ohio84, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry SOREL EXPLORER™ III Slip-On Women's Waterproof Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Explorer III Slip-On WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: So comfortable - I love that these are waterproof and so light but supportive
review.name: Love these

review.itemreviewed: Explorer III Slip-On WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The boot is great except the opening is very tight and I have high arches. For me it is difficult to get my foot in the boot. It takes to much time and energy to try and get this boot on. Comfy once on, easy to take off, even takes your socks off for you.
review.name: Not an easy entry

name: Explorer III Slip-On WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these but they fit me awkwardly. The legs are wide as shown, but the waist felt tight and not enough give.
review.name: Not for me

review.reviewBody: These are nice pants but didn’t work for me. Gorgeous color, nice fabric and seemed like good quality, but too tight in the waist. I wear a size 2 in the low-waist Dogtown shorts, but ordered a 6 in these based on other reviews. The 6 fit well overall but the waist was uncomfortable, and I think a size 8 would have been too big overall.
review.name: Waist too tight

review.reviewBody: These are becoming my favorite pants and I think I might be buying more in different colors. I find them flattering, very comfortable, and I love the Forest green color.
review.name: Beautiful pants!

review.reviewBody: Love, love, love these! Perfect stylish cords, soft and comfy. Gorgeous color and material, these cords are easy to pair with stylish boots or casual flats. Great go to pants!
review.name: Perfect cords!

review.reviewBody: Super bummed - these run small compared to the other pants I have from Carve.
review.name: Run small

review.reviewBody: These are a perfect weight for spring in a soft white. I would keep them if I had tried this brand before. The size I wear in other brands (pact, Volcom) is too small.
review.name: lovely fabric

review.reviewBody: One of my favorite pairs of pants! The material is so soft and the cut is flattering. It’s a very versatile pant, one that I can dress up with some wedges or dress down with sneakers.
review.name: Soft and well fitted

review.reviewBody: Los Smith Cheetah Polarized Sunglasses son únicos en todos los sentidos. La calidad de los materiales es excepcional, y el diseño combina perfectamente estilo y funcionalidad. Las lentes polarizadas hacen una gran diferencia, ya que ofrecen una visión súper clara y protegen eficazmente contra el brillo del sol. Sin duda, Smith nunca decepciona: siempre están en el punto con su calidad y estilo inigualables. ¡Los recomiendo al 100%!
Boyfriend got me these for my birthday, best pair of sunglasses I have ever had.
review.name: Best Sunnys

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had these sunglasses for less than two weeks. I’m meticulous with my sunglasses. I’ve had pairs for seriously years and they are in mint condition. I’ve had these for two weeks. I can’t get the lenses cleaned at all. And while trying to clean them they have a massive scratch on them using optical cleaning cloths. I’m seriously so disappointed with this product. These are my only set of Smith glasses. I’m pretty sure I won’t buy another. 
I gave them a 2 star rating because they look nice and are comfortable but the lense quality is terrible.
review.name: Impossible to keep clean

review.reviewBody: I love the design and color of these! I got the B4BC style and they are great looking sunnies. Unfortunately, the lenses have scratches super easily and there is even a crack through the lense. I have many other pairs of Smith sunglasses and love them. I haven't has issues like these before, and I have only had these a couple weeks.. so I'm not sure if it's just this particular pair, or what. I am bummed, especially given the price 😞 !
review.name: Love the design but quality is lacking!

review.reviewBody: Light and comfortable fit, great lenses, love the look
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: I didn’t like these the first week bc I didn’t know they were adjustable wire core acetate frames (none of that meant anything to me when I got them). I was bummed they were slipping at my nose, and was going to return them. After googling around, I learned what wire frame meant. If u look close there’s a wire running through the acetate material on the arms/temples, this means you can bend it to lock in around your ear. It’s not super flexy, so you won’t feel like ur wearing noodles. The feel is super strong, once you adjust slightly, make sure they are straight on your face or put them on a table to ensure both ends sit flat. From there, you are good to go. Wish Smith told me this at first!! I saw one review where someone returned them bc they were slipping… massive miscommunication. I would recommend these for the quality of material, light weight feel, daily style, and adjustability. What a game changer… I legit almost sent them back
review.name: These are adjustable and that is a game changer

review.reviewBody: The sunshades are a nice product but they are heavy and hurt my nose so, if I use them at all, I can only do for a very brief period of time,
review.name: Not happy with purchase.

review.reviewBody: Very stylish and unique cat eye style glasses. We bought these for my wife and she loves them. Thanks Smith!
review.name: Very stylish and unique cat

review.reviewBody: Love my Cheetah sunglasses! The fit, style and look is perfect. The quality and durability is outstanding.
review.name: Love my Cheetah sunglasses! The

review.reviewBody: I am a die hard Collete fan, I have a small/medium face and it is so hard to find a pair of sunglasses that hugs my temple just right. I have struggled for over a year finding a new pair since the Collete was discontinued. These are great and even fit better than my old glasses! New fav
review.name: Great fit

name: Cheetah Polarized Sunglasses - Women's
